sentence.Network_en: She speaks insincerely when she says nice things to others.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在恭维别人时总是言不由衷.

sentence.Network_en: This person is very slippery : he treats people completely insincerely.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个人很油滑,待人没有一点诚意.

sentence.Network_en: Was saying some speak insincerely speech, stabbing pain each other heart.
sentence.Network_cn: 说着一些言不由衷的话, 刺痛彼此的心.

PerfectNetExp.abs: insincere 虚假的insincerely 不诚实地insincerity 不真诚
Under some circumstances . we always habitually insincerely ., 在一些情况下 . 我们总是习惯性地言不由衷.
Friends 老友记第一季第十六集... ... personnel: 人事部 insincerely: 不诚实地,无诚意地 quizzical: 古怪的；疑惑的.

Mr Bush left the Hapsburg capital a bit like a ridiculed rich uncle at a family reunion , welcomed insincerely to his face and belittled behind his back .布什，象在一个在重新团聚的家族中受到挪愚的富舅舅，有点郁闷地离开了卢森堡的首都，来时受到诚挚地欢迎，走时受到贬损。

list.abs: a charming but thoroughly insincere woman ; their praise was extravagant and insincere ., 一个迷人但十分虚假的女人 ; 他们的吹捧过分而虚假.
Flattering in an insincere way ; obsequious ., 以不真诚的方式奉承的;

I was thinking that Victor had been to see Lily Lilac on every occasion that the Headmaster would allow . she was fairhaired and fine boneda breezy , insincere manner I found exasperating .我想起只要校长允许，维克托一有机会就去见莉丽。莱勒克。她有着漂亮的头发和身材，还有另我讨厌的傲慢和虚伪的态度。
Under some circumstances . we always habitually insincerely ., 在一些情况下 . 我们总是习惯性地言不由衷.
